DataElement.preferredName: NonHematologic Severe Life Threatening Adverse Event Toxicity Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to indicate that nonhematologic, chemotherapy-induced toxicity of grade 3 (severe) or grade 4 (life threatening or disabling) according to the Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 3.0, occurred. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: NonHematologic Severe Life Threatening Adverse Event Chemotherapy Toxicity Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Instance of nonhematologic, chemotherapy-induced toxicity that is grade 3 (severe) or grade 4 (life threatening or disabling) according to the Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version 3.0, that has occurred. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredName: Not Hematologic Severe Adverse Event Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event Chemotherapy Toxicity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition:
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming
organs.:Severe adverse event is an experience that requires therapeutic intervention and interrupts busual daily activities. See NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events.:Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04):Toxicity; the degree to which something is poisonous.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities.

Concepts.longName: Life Threatening or Disabling Adverse Event
Concepts.definition: Any adverse event that places the patient, in the view of the initial reporter, at immediate risk of death from the adverse event as it occurred, i.e., it does not include an adverse experience that, had it occurred in a more severe form, might have caused death.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects of something.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes or No to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
